723378f-a.title: Manhattan: Spring Street - Varick Street
723378f-a.text:
Spring Street at,and adjoining and East of the South East corner of Varick Street. To and ircluding 240 Spring Street,a little faced frame house. 256-254 Spring Street,the houses at and adjoining the Sooth East corner of Varick Street were demolished in I9I4 or I915,uhen Varick St. was widened it's entire length at the expense of the East Side,dring the construction of the
West Side Interborough Line.
The church is the Spring Street Prosbyterian Church,which was built on that site in (8II,and in it's present form since
I835.

723376f-a.title: Manhattan: Spring Street - Varick Street
723376f-a.text:
New York University Comnuunity Center, 244 Spring Street, south
side, east of Varick Street.
June 23, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
723376f-a.folder: Spring Street & Varick Street, Manhattan, NY

723379f-a.title: Manhattan: Spring Street - Varick Street
723379f-a.text:
Spring Street Presbyterian Church, adjoining the S.E. corner of Varick Street. This edifice was built in 1835, on the site of the original Spring Street Church, which was built here in 1811 of material from the old First Church in Wall Street. This print, of course, fails to show the color of the church, the
walls of which are a sort of salmon pink.
June 23, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
723379f-a.folder: Spring Street & Varick Street, Manhattan, NY
